Topic.Title: Pensions

Message.Msg: Or.... he's making it up, since the new contract has monthly premiums of $81 for a family in 2013. That is very, very low. The reality is workers are trading health care costs for pay and pension increases. But you're not going to mention your bigger checks, are you? Nope, you're just going blame Obama for the something the CWA asked for and got.

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: Prior to when the government broke up AT&T at divestiture, T was a regulated monopoly and the various public service commisions and FCC would not allow that to happen. Now that T is unregulated with competition, you are "allowed" to go elsewhere for your service.

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: Look on the bright side. It means AT&T has lots of business. More demand than supply is ideal for growth.

Message.Title: AT&T Bonds denominated in Euros
Message.Msg: AT&T is planning to issue bonds denominated in Euros. It must mean they expect inflation of the Euro to be even greater than the $$$. We already have 61 billion in debt and are perfectly positioned for the coming inflation.

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: If they are unwilling to satisfy that demand, they will have alot of unhappy customers. The days of unlimited plans is near. If they raise the prices for bandwidth hogs, it might actually drive some people back to cable, DISH, or Direct TV. Thoughts.........Kel

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: I'm sure AT&T monitors this board. Tell them where you live and I bet they will respond. AT&T covers the World and, if you contact them, they will probably adjust your bill for the lack of service and put your area on their "to do" list.

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: try and get through to them, I went back to cable. service was somewhat better, they all suck.

Topic.Title: PUT IN IRAs FOR 5% DIVIDEND!!

Message.Msg: IRAs are subject to government rules and regulations. I wouldn't trust them with my investments. The only advantage is a tax deduction when you put your money in and then you are stuck with what ever rule changes the government wants to make.

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: I don't think it works that way with dsl so much, cable yes. Call them and have them check it. If you go to another isp, they still go through the same att lines under contract I believe, pretty much there is one carrier or the other owning the lines. Mine works great for years. Get U verse if you can.

Topic.Title: ATT.....HORRIBLE DSL SERVICE...

Message.Msg: Go to DSLReports, then tools to test your bandwidth. Typically you never get the agreed bandwidth with DSL but I always get it at a minimum with cable. Cable is a much better technology than DSL.

Topic.Title: Has aggressive 'Fix The Debt' campaign started yet?

Message.Msg: That's all he is, is promises. I heard today that the lady he hugged in MC and promised to eliminate the red tape so that she and other could get a quicker response from the government still hasn't received any help from FEMA or other Federal agencies. He promised to create jobs yet we have the highest unemployment in decades. He promised to cut the deficit in half and instead tripled it. He promised a better, more civil Washington, then called a police department stupid before he had all the facts, put out campaign ads calling his opponent a felon and his supporters called him a tax cheat for not paying his taxes, a murderer for causing a women's cancer death, etc. He is a real charmer this guy is. If he can read someone else's word from a machine, he is a good speaker, when left to his own words, he is miserable. He is a lousy leader, when the heat hits, he disappears. Where was he when the Libyan fiasco was going down? Where was he when the nation wanted answers? He sent out someone he admits didn't have anything to do with Libya or knew what happened so he could go begging. A real leader! He is all promise and no delivery, other than his health care bill that few wanted and most still dislike.

Topic.Title: Warren Buffet: cap gain 30%, 50% tax on the rich

Message.Msg: Oh don't fret yourself about my confusion. I am not confused about Congress; they are the group that is confused. They for some unknown reason that defies all logic think they are the only ones that can fix our fiscal problems, not being intelligent enough to realize they are the cause of the problems. Poor decision-making, lack of oversight of their past decisions and complete ignorance of what their constituents are asking them to do. They spend so much time on vacation I am shocked they found the time to screw things up so royally! I guess they have more talent that we realize; unfortunately it is a talent that will lead to the destruction of our economy for good. I in fact have had to develop budgets and to actually track performance to those budgets and correct any deficiencies in expected performance. My future income, position, promotions and continued employment depended on meeting those expectations. Unlike Congress who simply expects to be treated like royalty with no expectations or accountability for their performance.

Topic.Title: Belly putters will be made obsolete!

Message.Msg: The Cisco speaks only the truth: Thousand Oaks, CA – The United States Golf Association and the Royal & Ancient Golf Club announced on Wednesday a proposal to ban anchored strokes. At the core of the issue are long putters and belly putters, which have been used by three of the past five major champions.

Topic.Title: Warren Buffet: cap gain 30%, 50% tax on the rich

Message.Msg: Easy answer to your quandary...the lobbyists, all of them; those that patronize the Democrats and Republicans both. Congress responds to lobbyists more aggressively than they do the voters or even the President. The lobbyist finance their campaigns, they boondoggle trips to place they have no business being, furnish jobs for those that are retiring or have lost a recent election but still have friends in Washington. Grover has no more influence than the lobbyists that call on Harry and/or Nancy or fed fat Teddy before he passed. He has simply become the whipping boy for you loud-mouthed liberals. Congress is out of control and our present leader (who infamously voted present more than anything else) doesn’t have the chops to put them in line. We are strapped with this President for the next four years unless many of the missing truths about his past are discovered, but we do have the mid-term elections to do something about this lazy, incompetent, corrupt Congress. It remains to be seen if the American people have the guts to do something about the corruption and ignorance in Congress. I won't however hold my breath.

Topic.Title: 52 week low is getting higher...

Message.Msg: A year ago today T closed at $27.95 and began a steady climb until $38 at the end of July. A 36% increase. Beat inflation by a long shot. Since July we spent two months in the $37 to $38 range then dropped the next two months to close at $33.62 today. Look for T to trade at $33.50 +- $1.00 for the rest of this year. The $30 in Feb depends on what the overall market does after January 1.

Topic.Title: Pensions

Message.Msg: Retiree, 2 dependents $270.69 per month starting Jan. 2013. Took lump sum 2002, no yearly raises like present employees. Since we started paying for medical every year has been different,2013 being the highest. Wish lump sum would have been more to offset this.
